section.rollover: Displays the framework's and system's information
An extensive online resource list where you can find more useful information about ColdBox
Creates the on the fly documentation for the framework's cfc's
Displays an overview of the framework's settings
From here you can change the coldbox logging facility's parameters
From here you can change the general framework settings.
Change your dashboard password, securely!!
Change your proxy settings, if needed.
Change the caching configuration parameters.
Launches the ColdBox application builder wizard.
Your very own cfc generator based on Brian Rinaldi's Illidium Generator
Lanuches ColdBox very own log viewer application.
Launches the ColdBox application builder wizard.
The application mapping. This can be either relative to the web root or using a coldfusion mapping. You can also browse for it by clicking on the folder icon.
Flag that determines if the ColdBox debugging will be carried out. This can slow down your application due to the timers and the rendering of the debugging screen. Use only for development.
The password you will use to go into debug mode or out if activating from the url action.
Flag that determines if you can use the 'dumpvar' url action to dump variables in debug mode.
The location relative from the application root or using cfmx mappings of a udf template to load on all views, layouts and event handlers.
The css class name to use when rendering the messagebox. This class has to be loaded on your stylesheet. Look at the messagebox.cfm for a template css.
The default layout template to use for your application. This will be generated since you are starting a new project. The name choosen is just a best practice.
Flag that determines if the application will use the embedded ColdBox logging facility. If you select ENABLED make sure you fill out the location.
The location of where ColdBox will store your log file. This is either relative from your application root or an absolute path.
Flag that determines wether to use the coldfusion logging facilities or not.
The generator will create one event handler for you with your default event and any of the other events you select.
This is the default event to fire when you start your application or when no event can be found. This method will be generated for you
Check on this item and the generator will create the onApplicationStart method for you on the main event handler.
Check on this item and the generator will create the onRequestEnd method for you on the main event handler.
Check on this item and the generator will create the onRequestStart method for you on the main event handler.
Check on this item and the generator will create the onException method for you on the main event handler.
If you have a development mapping different than your production mapping, then please fill this entry out.
This flag tells the framework to reload all the configuration file and framework structures on every request. ONLY FOR DEVELOPMENT
This flag tells the framework to reload the event handler's method's index on every request. ONLY FOR DEVELOPMENT
This flag enables the emailing of bug reports whenever errors are detected on the application.
Enter all the email addresses that will receive bug reports for this application.
ColdBox can detect your running environment by entering URL snippets for the development environments.
Enable or disable Localization and i18N capabilities for your application.
Choose the default locale for your application. This is a list of valid locales for ColdFusion and ColdBox
Choose the storage scope for the default locale. This is used internally by ColdBox.
Enter the name of your main resource bundle if you are using one. Do not enter the locale or .properties extension. These are added by ColdBox.
The alias name of a webservice wsdl URL
The development URL of the web service wsdl. Leave blank if it is the same as the production URL
The name of the skeleton to save on disk for future generation.
The location on the web server of where to generate and deploy the application.
Check for any ColdBox updates via the online utility.
Submit a new bug to the offical bug email address.
Visit the official Trac bug database and run ticket reports, view progress, etc.
